Entries.Mon2: All right. What is it you want from me, anyway?
Entries.Mon4: Still haven't given up yet, huh?#$e#The farm, I mean. Still goin'?
Entries.Mon6: I'm surprised you want to be friends with an old-timer like me.
Entries.Mon8: Is there really a place for me in this world, anymore?#$e#Maybe that's just the way it has to be.
Entries.Mon10: You may or may not have heard already, but our daughter passed away some years ago.$s#$e#I don't know how Evelyn manages each day. I know that she's just as broken up about it as I am.$s
Entries.Tue: Hmmph... Looks like another gloomy day.
Entries.Tue2: Yeah, look at you, runnin' around like that. Just rub it in, why don't ya?
Entries.Tue4: What're you doing, wasting your time talking to an old man like me?#$e#Don't young people even stay busy anymore?
Entries.Tue6: I don't understand what you young people are planning to do with this world.#$e#All I can say is that it ain't the world I once knew.
Entries.Tue10: You know, I shouldn't get too depressed about my legs.#$e#I should just be happy that I'm alive.$h
Entries.Wed2: Are you trying to get me to buy something? I'm not interested.
Entries.Wed4: You be thankful for what you have on that farm, d'you hear?#$e#Before you know it, life'll pull the rug out from under you.#$e#It's only a matter of time.
Entries.Wed8: I wish my legs worked so I could play catch with Alex.$s#$e#That'll never happen.$s
Entries.Wed10: @! Let me turn off this darned television and we can have a little chat.$h#$e#So what are the young people doing these days?
Entries.Thu2: What do you want? Now's not a good time.#$e#Why? 'Cause it ain't.
Entries.Thu4: Looks like another rerun today.#$e#Shouldn't you be out and about?
Entries.Thu8: You ever watch this show "36"? Now that's some good entertainment.$h#$e#Nobody ever stops this guy from fighting the terrorists. He just does whatever he wants and it's hilarious.$h
Entries.Thu10: There are few things better in life than a nice fresh leek, wouldn't you say?$h#$e#What? What's wrong with leeks? They're not just 'good,' they're outstanding. Everyone loves leeks.#$e#Do young people not love leeks anymore? Man alive...$3
Entries.Fri: That farm's been in miserable shape for years.#$e#And you want to restore it? Hmph. Good luck.
Entries.Fri2: So you're a farmer, huh? At least it's honest work.
Entries.Fri6: You be thankful now, that Stardew Valley is one of the few places where you can still work the land how you want.#$e#These politicians just want to regulate, regulate, regulate like they own this country. Hmph.
Entries.Sat: The weekend is no different than any other time, for me.#$e#That's how it is when you're retired.
Entries.Sat2: Hi there.#$e#What's going on out there, anyway?
Entries.Sat4: My prescription just keeps getting more and more expensive.#$e#This wouldn't have been a problem a generation or two ago. But these drug companies keep hiking the cost!
Entries.Sat6: Is it the weekend already? I guess I'll have to get out of the house soon, then.
Entries.Sat8: Evelyn's always been the best cook I know. And she just keeps getting better.#$e#Wish I could say the same about something I can do.$s
Entries.Sun: What's it take for a little peace and quiet around here?
Entries.Sun2: Aren't you cold? They don't make sweaters like they used to.#$e#*Sigh*
Entries.Sun4: Is it the end of the week already? I lose track of what day it is.
Entries.Sun6: It'll be good to be out of the house for a while.#$e#What are you up to today, young man?^What are you up to today, young miss?
Entries.Sun10: I didn't spend much time praying till recently.#$b#For a while, I was furious with Yoba, what with me losing everything I had.#$e#I have a kernel of faith that there's something better for me after this old body's ticker runs out.#$b#It's not much, but what's an old man like me to do?$s
Entries.summer_Mon10: You keep workin' hard on that farm, y'hear? Somebody's gotta feed this old town if the world's economy bottoms out.#$e#D'you know what I mean?
Entries.summer_Tue10: From time to time, I can still see Clara in Alex's eyes.#$e#Alex is a good kid. You make sure you look out for him.
Entries.summer_Wed10: Bah! It's so hot! I'm in a cranky mood today.#$e#What? An old guy like me is allowed to be cranky when it's this hot.
Entries.summer_Fri10: Some of the things you see on the news these days... Why are young people so lazy these days?#$e#At least you've got some sense about hard work. But some young people just want the world to roll out a red carpet for 'em.
Entries.summer_Sun10: Whoa there! You'd better make way for me when I'm on the move, you rascal, or I might just run you down with this juggernaut!$h
Entries.fall_Mon10: Recently, I've been trying my best to stay positive each day.#$e#It isn't always easy. I apologize if I seem a little up and down.
Entries.fall_Tue10: When you get as old as me it's a lot harder to adjust to new things.#$e#One day you'll know what I mean.#$e#Go on, enjoy yourself while you're still young.
Entries.fall_Thu10: I don't watch the news to "stay informed." I watch it because I just want to know what's going on.#$e#Look, there's a difference, okay?
Entries.fall_Fri10: I'm not stupid. I know there's some bias in the news programs. I just keep my thinking cap on while I watch.#$b#That's what everyone needs to do.
Entries.fall_Sat10: Tomorrow's an altar day. The way things used to be, you'd see half the town showing up at the Shrine of Yoba each Sunday.
Entries.fall_Sun10: Yep, I can do jumps, wheelies, spins... all kinds of tricks.$h#$e#Look over there!#$b#Oop, ya just missed me doing a somersault. Too bad.$h
Entries.winter_Wed10: Don't go wasting your youthful energy, @. You've gotta put in enough living for the both of us, y'hear?
Entries.winter_Thu10: I wonder what Evelyn's baking today...? Did she mention anything?#$e#Oh, I don't know, she may have mentioned something to me. But who am I to remember?
Entries.winter_Sat10: Sometimes I wonder if everybody is just waiting for me to die.#$b#Heh. I'll show them. I have plenty of years left in this old body.
Entries.winter_Sun10: I don't know how Evelyn even puts up with me anymore.$s#$e#Sometimes I feel more like a patient than her husband.$s
Entries.summer_10: What? There's another festival tomorrow? Didn't we just have one?
Entries.winter_15: Night Market? No thank you. Nothing would make me want to go to that aberrant sideshow.#$e#Why's it have to be so late, anyway?
Entries.winter_24: Now why wouldn't I be excited about tomorrow? Take a wild guess.#$e#Oh, do you enjoy sitting in the freezing cold for hours?
Entries.winter_28: Another year gone. My life feels like a flip-book.
Entries.spring_1_2: Everyone in the news is just talking new year's this, new year's that. Isn't anything happening in the world?#$e#Hah, the news people must assume the whole world just stops when they stop talking about it.$h
Entries.summer_10_2: What? There's another festival tomorrow? Didn't we just have one?
Entries.winter_15_2: Night Market? No thank you. Nothing would make me want to go to that aberrant sideshow.#$e#Why's it have to be so late, anyway?
Entries.winter_24_2: Now why wouldn't I be excited about tomorrow? Take a wild guess.#$e#Oh, do you enjoy sitting in the freezing cold for hours?
Entries.winter_28_2: Another year gone. My life feels like a flip-book.
